project.name: Crypt.cs
project.description: Simple string encoder (Base64, CRC32, DES, MD, SHA...).

Crypt.EncoderManager.name: Crypt.EncoderManager
Crypt.EncoderManager.description: Facilitates access to the string encoders at run time.

DigiWar.Security.Cryptography.UnixCrypt.name: DigiWar.Security.Cryptography.UnixCrypt
DigiWar.Security.Cryptography.UnixCrypt.description:
Provides the Unix `crypt()` encryption algorithm.

This class is a port from Java source. I do not understand the underlying algorithms, I just converted it to C# and it works.
Because I do not understand the underlying algorithms I cannot give most of the variables useful names. I have no clue what their
significance is. I tried to give the variable names as much meaning as possible, but the original source just called them `a`, `b`, `c`, etc...

A very important thing to note is that all integers in this code are UNSIGNED integers! Do not change this, ever!!! It will seriously fuckup the working
of this class. It uses major bitshifting and while Java gives you the >>> operator to signify a right bitshift without setting the MSB for
a signed integer, C# does not have this operator and will just set the new MSB for you if it happened to be set the moment you bitshifted it.
This is undesirable for most bitshifts and in the cases it did matter, I casted the variable back to an integer. This was only required where
a variable was on the right-side of a bitshift operator.

classitems.description:
Checks that all conditions are met for application startup.
If no string encoder can be found, a message is displayed to the user and the application terminated.
classitems.name: CheckSetup

classitems.description: Encodes and prints a given string using the specified encoding method.
classitems.name: PrintEncodedString

params.name: encodingMethod
params.description: The name of the encoding method to use.

classitems.description: Prints the list of supported string encoders.
classitems.name: PrintEncoderList

classitems.description: Prints informations about the program version.
classitems.name: PrintVersion

classitems.description: The list of all available string encoders.
classitems.name: Encoders

classitems.description:
The list with characters allowed in a Unix encrypted password.
It is used to randomly chose two characters for use in the encryption.
classitems.name: m_encryptionSaltCharacters

classitems.description:
A lookup-table, presumably filled with some sort of encryption key. 
It is used to calculate the index to the `m_SPTranslationTable` lookup-table.
classitems.name: m_saltTranslation

classitems.description:
A lookup-table.
It is used to calculate the index to the `m_skb` lookup-table.
classitems.name: m_shifts

classitems.description:
A lookup-table.
It is used the dynamically create the schedule lookup-table.
classitems.name: m_skb

classitems.description:
A lookup-table.
It is used to calculate two integers that are used to encrypt the password.
classitems.name: m_SPTranslationTable

classitems.description:
A lookup-table filled with printable characters.
It is used to make sure the encrypted password contains only printable characters. It is filled with
ASCII characters 46 - 122 (from the dot (`.`) until (including) the lowercase `'z'`).
classitems.name: m_characterConversionTable

classitems.description: Marks the size of the dynamically created schedule lookup-table.
classitems.name: m_desIterations

classitems.description: Converts four seperate bytes into one unsigned integer.
classitems.name: FourBytesToInt

params.name: inputBytes
params.description: The bytes to use for the conversion.

params.name: offset
params.description: The offset at which to start in the `inputBytes` buffer.

classitems.description: Converts an unsigned integer into 4 seperate bytes.
classitems.name: IntToFourBytes

params.name: outputBytes
params.description: The byte buffer into which to store the result.

params.name: offset
params.description: The offset to start storing at in the `outputBytes` buffer.

classitems.description: Performs some operation on 4 unsigned integers. It's labeled `PERM_OP` in the original source.
classitems.name: PermOperation

params.name: firstInt
params.description: The first unsigned integer to use.

params.name: secondInt
params.description: The second unsigned integer to use.

params.name: thirdInt
params.description: The third unsigned integer to use.

params.name: fourthInt
params.description: The fourth unsigned integer to use.

params.name: operationResults
params.description: An array of 2 unsigned integers that are the result of this operation.

classitems.description: Performs some operation on 3 integers. It's labeled `HPERM_OP` in the original source.
classitems.name: HPermOperation

params.name: firstInt
params.description: The first unsigned integer to use.

params.name: secondInt
params.description: The second signed integer to use.

params.name: thirdInt
params.description: The third unsigned integer to use.

return.description: An integer that is the result of this operation.

classitems.description: This method does some very complex bit manipulations.
classitems.name: SetDESKey

params.name: encryptionKey
params.description: The input data to use for the bit manipulations.

return.description: `m_desIterations * 2` number of unsigned integers that are the result of the manipulations.

classitems.description: This method does some bit manipulations.
classitems.name: DEncrypt

params.name: left
params.description: An input that is manipulated and then used for output.

params.name: right
params.description: This is used for the bit manipulation.

params.name: scheduleIndex
params.description: The index of an uint to use from the `schedule` array.

params.name: firstSaltTranslator
params.description: The translated salt for the first salt character.

params.name: secondSaltTranslator
params.description: The translated salt for the second salt character.

classitems.description: Calculates two unsigned integers that are used to encrypt the password.
classitems.name: Body

classitems.description: Encrypts the specified string using the Unix `crypt` algorithm.
classitems.name: Crypt

params.name: encryptionSalt
params.description: 2 random printable characters that are used to randomize the encryption.

params.name: textToEncrypt
params.description: The text that must be encrypted.

classitems.description: Instance used to generate a random number sequence.
classitems.name: random

Checks that all conditions are met for application startup.
If no string encoder can be found, a message is displayed to the user and the application terminated.
